alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 6:09PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following counties, Baldwin and Mobile. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a complex of intense thunderstorms moving across portions of northern Baldwin and northeastern Mobile counties. These storms will produce torrential rainfall amounts in excess of 1 to 2 inches in a short period of time and will likely result in ponding of water on area roadways and flooding of urban and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Saraland, Bay Minette, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Spanish Fort, Creola, Stapleton, Axis, I65 And AL 225, I65 And AL 158, I65 And I165, Crossroads, Whitehouse Forks, Bromley, D`Olive, Douglasville, Vangordon and Pine Haven. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
